data.title: Happening around Delta: week of Dec. 7
data.meta_description: Weekly events and community listings for North Delta and beyond
data.text:
COMMUNITY FORUM

• Voices for Peace: Dec. 10, 2 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.; Baitur Rahman Mosque, 9570 River Rd.; Join us for an inspiring event promoting peace and harmony by Ahmadiyya Muslim Jama’at BC. Representatives from various faith groups, including Christianity, Judaism and Islam, will share their perspectives on peace. Following their presentations, there will be an engaging discussion with the panelists. This exciting in-person gathering aims to bring together people from diverse backgrounds to foster unity and spread messages of love and peace. Let’s mark our calendars and ensure our voices resound at Voices for Peace. Doors open at 1:30 p.m. Refreshments will be served. RSVP by calling 1-877-994-7526 or emailng ahmadiyya.bc.outreach@gmail.com.

HOLIDAY EVENTS

• Christmas Storytime: Dec. 8, 10:30 a.m. to 11 a.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Introduce kids to the love of books and language with a festive Christmas Storytime! Children and caregivers will enjoy interactive Christmas stories, songs, rhymes and more. Storytime prepares children to learn to read. Learn more at fvrl.ca. Looking for more Storytime fun? Check out our on-demand content on Facebook or YouTube.

• Christmas Bake Sale: Dec. 9, 2 p.m.; Trinity Lutheran Church, 11040 River Rd.; North Delta’s Trinity Lutheran Church is having their big Christmas bake sale on Saturday, Dec. 9 in the church hall. Lots of baking (including Norwegian rosettes and krumkake), gift baskets, and complimentary beverages and home-made cookies. For more information, please call the church office at 604-584-0111.

• Grinch Trivia: Dec. 12, 3:30 p.m. to 4:15 p.m.; via Zoom; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. It’s the most wonderful time of the year! Journey through Whoville and get in the holiday spirit with our Grinch trivia event. Participate by yourself or gather together with the other Whos in your household and play as a team. Register for free at fvrl.ca.

• Delta Concert Band Christmas Concert: Dec. 12, 7:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Enjoy an evening concert featuring Christmas favourites and a singalong with the Delta Concert Band as part of the City of Delta’s Fall Music Series. Entry is free with the donation of a non-perishable food item.

• Christmas Lights Tour: Dec. 13, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; Take a tour of the beautiful Christmas lights in Delta, then enjoy a mug of hot chocolate at the Kennedy. Tickets cost $10 (for Kennedy members only). To purchase tickets, call 604-594-2717 or visit the customer service desk.

• Free Christmas Wrapping: Dec. 14, 9:30 a.m. to 12 p.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; If you love buying presents but hate fighting with the wrapping paper, we have a deal for you! We are offering free gift wrapping to Kennedy members on these two dates. Book your date through the customer service desk by calling 604-594-2717. Boxes to place gifts in are not included.

• Youth Christmas Market: Dec. 15, 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.; Dec. 16, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Tsawwassen Arts Centre, 1172 56th Ave.; The City of Delta is fuelling the entrepreneurial spirit and artistic passions of young artisans by providing a venue for selling crafts and a meeting place for like-minded individuals to share new ideas and learn the business side of marketing arts and crafts. To register as a vendor, visit cityofdelta.perfectmind.com.

• The Nutcracker: Dec. 16 and 17, 1 p.m. and 6 p.m.; Genesis Theatre, 5005 45th Ave.; Embark on a joyful journey as Studio West Dance brings The Nutcracker to life this December at Ladner’s Genesis Theatre. Immerse yourself in the magic of the holiday season with our spellbinding production, featuring exquisite dancers, dazzling sets and Tchaikovsky’s iconic score. This is more than a performance — it’s a celebration of artistry and tradition. Reserve your seats now at studiowestdance.ca for an enchanting evening that promises to capture the hearts of audiences young and old. Tickets $24, or $220 for a pack of 10. Don’t miss out on the magic!

• Christmas/Holiday Luncheon: Dec. 19, 12 p.m. to 2 p.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; Enjoy a delightful Christmas luncheon with all the trimmings, followed by John Parsons, a one-man band playing familiar tunes, including some Christmas songs. Cost is $25 for members, $30 for guests, and available for purchase by calling the Kennedy at 604-594-2717 or visiting the customer service desk.

• Movie Night — The Polar Express: Dec. 19, 6:30 p.m. to 8:15 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Hosted by the City of Delta. All aboard! Sit back, relax and join the journey to the North Pole. Popcorn is included in the $5 admission fee and there will be concession items for sale.

• Movie Night — Elf: Dec. 22, 6:30 p.m. to 8:15 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Hosted by the City of Delta. Get cozy, wear your holiday pajamas and enjoy a Christmas movie classic in Elf! Popcorn is included in the $5 admission fee and there will be concession items for sale.

• New Year’s Eve Fancy Family Fête: Dec. 31, 1 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.; Douglas J. Husband Discovery Centre, 4450 Clarence Taylor Cres.; Dressing fancy and celebrating New Year’s Eve isn’t only for adults. Join us at the Discovery Centre for a family-friendly New Year’s Eve celebration anytime between 1 and 6:30 p.m. Come dressed in your fancy attire to celebrate an early New Year’s Eve countdown with activities, light refreshments and a photo booth.

• 2024 Polar Bear Swim: Jan. 1, 11:45 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.; Boundary Bay Regional Park, 300 Boundary Bay Rd.; The City of Delta is hosting the 2024 Polar Bear Swim at Centennial Beach. Activities begin at 11:45 a.m., with registration opening at noon and the swim taking place at 1 p.m. Prizes and awards are available.

MUSIC

• Open Stage: Dec. 15, 7:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Entertain and be entertained. Share the stage with a variety of singers, musicians, poets, actors and dancers in this intergenerational monthly evening. Performing not your thing? Then sit back and enjoy the show! Doors open at 7 p.m., with showtime at 7:30. Light refreshments will be served. $5 entry for all. Register for Open Stage at cityofdelta.perfectmind.com.

• Delta Ukulele Circle: First Saturday of the month (Jan. 6), 2:30 p.m. to 5 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Led by Gary Cyr, the Delta Ukulele Circle is an enthusiastic, welcoming and supportive crowd of music lovers with an appreciation for the ukulele. This tiny instrument provides a unique opportunity for individuals wanting to play and enjoy music together with others in a very social setting. Admission is $5. Doors open at 2 p.m, circle starts at 2:30 p.m. Register at cityofdelta.perfectmind.com. More information at deltaukes.com.

• Vancouver Chamber Music Society North Delta Matinee Series: various dates, 1 p.m.; North Delta Centre for the Arts, 11425 84th Ave.; Don’t miss out on this exceptional opportunity to enrich your life with the power of music. Reserve your seats for the 2023/24 North Delta: Matinee Series today and secure your place at these remarkable performances: VAM Chamber Players (Jan. 30), Molly Carr & Anna Petrova (Feb. 20), VAM Chamber Players (April 9), New Orford String Quartet (May 14). Tickets are $25, available at vancouverchambermusic.com/delta.

• Vancouver Chamber Music Society Delta Evening Series: various dates, 7:30 p.m.; South Delta Baptist Church, 1988 56th St.; Don’t miss out on this exceptional opportunity to enrich your life with the power of music. Reserve your seats for the 2023/24 Delta Evening Concert Series today and secure your place at these remarkable performances: Trio Seoul (Feb. 23), Stefan Jackiw & Kevin Ahfat (March 8), New Orford String Quartet (May 17). Tickets are $40 ($20 for students) and available at vancouverchambermusic.com/delta.

• Blue Moon Marquee: March 9, 7:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m.; Genesis Theatre, 5005 45th Ave.; Carving a path through blues, jazz, jump jive, folk, country, swing, and Indigenous soul with an authentic spirit, Blue Moon Marquee’s sound does not idle easily in one certain category. It stomps and struts through the wilds, conjuring a blend where Howlin’ Wolf tangos with Django, Ernest Tubb shoots firecrackers with Cab Calloway, and Memphis Minnie throws dice with Screamin’ Jay Hawkins. Tickets are $40, available at genesis-theatre.tickit.ca or by calling 604-940-5550.

WRITING

• DLAS Writers’ Circles: First Sunday of the month (Jan. 7), 12 p.m. to 1:30 p.m.; Douglas J. Husband Discovery Centre, 4450 Clarence Taylor Cres.; first Wednesday of the month (Jan. 3), 6 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Delta Literary Arts Society is hosting free drop-in writers’ circles in Ladner and North Delta each month. These supportive gatherings are for writers of all levels with prompts, optional sharing and time for socializing led by caring and creative hosts. For more info, visit dlas.ca or email deltaliteraryartssociety@gmail.com.

AUTHOR TALKS

• Sarah Mlynowski: Jan. 23, 1:30 p.m. to 2:30 p.m.; via Zoom; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. The Reading Link Challenge Team is pleased to present Sarah Mlynowski, author of Upside Down Magic, one of the RLC titles this year. Meet the author behind the book in our online author visit.

HOBBIES/CRAFTS

• Delta Photo Club: Wednesdays, 7:15 to 9:30 p.m.; via Zoom; The Delta Photo Club is dedicated to improving photography and photographic art in its various forms within the Surrey, North Delta, Ladner and Tsawwassen communities, including our neighbours in Point Roberts. Meetings are currently held via Zoom on Wednesday evenings, September through May. For more information, visit deltaphotoclub.com.

• Knit ‘n’ Stitch: Fridays, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Pack up your needles and yarn and head to the library. Knitting, crocheting, quilting and weaving are fun ways to connect across the generations. Join members of all ages and abilities to share ideas, techniques, and good conversation.

KIDS/TEENS

• George Mackie Library Teen Advisory Group: First Tuesday of the month (Jan 2), 6 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Teen Advisory Group (TAG) is for students between the ages of 13-19. TAG members help staff develop teen oriented programs and assist at the bigger library events. They will also act as a library representative in North Delta’s teen community. The monthly meetings are a time to socialize and plan. Membership is a resume booster and helps earn volunteer hours. All teens in North Delta are welcome. Refreshments are served. Registration is required. To join, pick up and fill out the application form and drop it off at the George Mackie Library.

• Babytime: Mondays, 10:30 a.m. to 11 a.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Make language fun and help your baby develop speech and language skills. Enjoy bouncing, singing and rhyming with stories. Babytime is a fun, social bonding activity for babies and caregivers. This program is best suited to children ages 0 to 2. Looking for more Babytime fun? Check out our on-demand content on Facebook or YouTube.

• Lego Club: Tuesdays, 3:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Love Lego? We provide the Lego, you bring your imagination! Come play, create and experiment. Lego Club is a fun afternoon program for kids. Children under 5 must be accompanied by an adult.

• Storytime: Fridays and Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 11 a.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Join our staff and other families live on Zoom for Storytime and introduce kids to the love of books and language. Children and caregivers will enjoy interactive stories, songs, rhymes and more. Storytime prepares children to learn to read. Learn more at fvrl.ca. Looking for more Storytime fun? Check out our on-demand content on Facebook or YouTube.

SENIORS

• Community Learning Program with Delta Police Recruits: Dec. 21, 12:30 p.m. to 4 p.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; We are honoured to have been chosen by the Delta Police Department to host new recruits at the Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre. Invite a friend and join us for a day of community connections. Some of the activities planned include a party in the café featuring light refreshments and seasonal treats, and free drop-in programs like carpet bowling, table tennis, pickleball, samba, acrylic arts, a holiday movie and more. This is a unique opportunity to interact with Delta Police recruits, ask questions and support their community engagement. We hope to see you there!

• Black, White & Bling New Year Dinner/Dance: Jan. 6; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; Celebrate the New Year at this semi-formal dinner and dance. Enjoy a four-course meal including appetizer, garden salad, chicken cordon bleu, potatoes, seasonal vegetables and a delectable dessert, then dance the night away to the live music of Sweet Max. Doors open at 4:45 p.m., with dinner service at 5:15 p.m. and dancing from 7 to 9 p.m. Tickets cost $30 for members, $35 for guests, and can be purchased by calling the Kennedy at 604-594-2717 or visiting the customer service desk.

• Choose to Move Info Session: Jan. 17, 10:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; Sign up now for this free and flexible program that provides you with the motivation and support to become more active. Choose to Move can help you to integrate activity into your daily routine, meet new friends, and make a positive change. Choose to Move is great for older adults who want to become active, regardless of ability. We are currently only accepting applicants who have never attended the Choose to Move program before. Members who have previously completed the Choose to Move program may waitlist for the ActivAge program and will be notified when space is available. Please reach out to the front desk by calling 604-594-2717 for more information.

• Crime Stoppers Presentation on Elder Abuse: Jan. 22, 10:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; Educate and protect yourself from elder abuse. Metro Vancouver Crime Stoppers wants seniors to know that they are not alone and have resources available to them. This month’s presentation will be about physical, emotional, and psychological abuse. Register by calling the Kennedy at 604-594-2717 or visiting the customer service desk.

• UVIC Chronic Pain Self-Management Workshop: Jan. 25, 1:30 p.m. to 4 p.m.; Kennedy Seniors Recreation Centre, 11760 88th Ave.; This is a free four-day leader training workshop for the chronic conditions self-management program. The University of Victoria delivers self-management programs for persons living with chronic health conditions in communities across B.C. These evidence-based programs are led by trained volunteers, and we are currently looking for people to lead these programs. Training and support will be provided. If you are interested in becoming a leader and helping others to live a healthier, happier life, then this training opportunity may be for you. Register by calling the Kennedy at 604-594-2717 or visiting the customer service desk.

• Drop-In Technology Help: Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; Tsawwassen Town Centre, 1249 56th St.; ElderCollege Delta offers drop-in technology help most Wednesdays. These sessions are free to members and non-members alike. Drop-in sessions are not intended to be full-blown lessons, rather a little something to help you out with hurdles that you may be encountering while using your device — for example attaching files, saving pictures or purchasing tickets online. Registration is not mandatory but appreciated. For further information or to register, please email eldercollegedelta@gmail.com.

BOOK CLUBS

• ESOL Book Club: Wednesdays, 1 p.m. to 2 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Join us and take part in an educational and fun weekly book club just for ESOL (English speaker of other language) speakers. Discuss a book together and learn new words and phrases to gain confidence in expressing yourself more accurately and precisely.

• Tuesday Evening Book Club: Second Tuesday of the month (Dec. 12), 7 p.m. to 7:45 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Join us to discuss books in a casual setting. New members are welcome. Books are provided.

• Thursday Afternoon Book Club: Third Thursday of the month (Dec. 21), 1:15 p.m. to 2:45 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Join us to discuss books in a casual setting. New members are welcome. Books are provided.

HEALTH/WELLNESS

• Free Yoga Classes: various days and times; via Zoom; Deltassist is now offering five free online yoga classes each week. Registration is ongoing and you can enjoy the classes from the comfort of your home. The Yoga for Stress Relief program runs Mondays from 6-7 p.m. (Yin Yoga), Wednesdays from 7-8 p.m. (Restorative Yoga) and Fridays from 10-11 a.m. (Hatha Yoga). Meanwhile, the Yoga Towards Recovery program runs Mondays from 7:30-8:30 p.m. (Wind Down Yoga) and Tuesdays from 6:30-7:30 a.m. (Rise & Shine Yoga). For info or to register, email Carlee at carleef@deltassist.com.

OUTREACH/SUPPORT GROUPS

• Settlement Workers at the Library (Dari/Pashto): First Tuesday of the month (Dec. 5), 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Are you an international student, work permit holder, refugee, refugee claimant, permanent resident or a Canadian citizen who needs help adjusting to your new life? Do you need help accessing resources or finding the support you need to thrive in B.C.? Free and confidential services are offered to help newcomers and citizens — with all their needs — during the process of settling into their new community. Settlement and Integration Services are free for those who need them in B.C.

• Settlement Workers at the Library (English/Punjabi/Hindi): Second and fourth Tuesday of the month (Dec. 12), 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.; George Mackie Library, 8440 112th St.; Hosted by Fraser Valley Regional Library. Are you an international student, work permit holder, refugee, refugee claimant, permanent resident or a Canadian citizen who needs help adjusting to your new life? Do you need help accessing resources or finding the support you need to thrive in B.C.? Free and confidential services are offered to help newcomers and citizens — with all their needs — during the process of settling into their new community. Settlement and Integration Services are free for those who need them in B.C.

• From Safety to Self-Compassion: Thursdays, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.; Deltassist, North Delta office, 9097 120th St.; This group is for women who are survivors of childhood sexual abuse. The group will create a safe environment for you to give voice to your story and feel validated. You will be encouraged to create your own internal and external safety. The group will cover topics like establishing boundaries, consolidating a sense of self, reflecting on the journey and cultivating a future from here on. Please note that this is an in-person group and Deltassist is taking all necessary precautionary measures to ensure everyone’s safety to minimize the transmission of COVID-19. For more information or to register, contact Irene at 604-238-4009 ext.116 or irenem@deltassist.com, or Jasmeet at 604-594-3455 ext. 104 or jasmeetb@deltassist.com.

• Surrey Prostate Cancer Support Group: Last Saturday of the month (Nov. 25), 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; Valley View Memorial Gardens, 14644 72 Ave., Surrey; All men who have been diagnosed and treated for prostate cancer, their spouses, friends and family are invited to join. Fore more info go to prostatecancerbc.ca or call 604-574-4012.

CLUBS

• Canadian Federation of University Women, North Delta/Surrey: CFUW is a national non-partisan, voluntary, self-funded organization working to improve the status of women and to promote human rights, public education, social justice and peace. The North Delta/Surrey club meets monthly (via Zoom at the present time) and is open to all women graduates, students and women who share the ideals of CFUW. For more information, call Barb (604-594-6145) or Eleanor (604-589-3631) or email northdeltasurreycfuw@gmail.com.
